comments.body:
On my first attempt, I checked for duplicate sub-field names but this failed when repeated collection fields were added: 
```shell
C++ exception with description "field name 'std::vector<float>' already exists
```
I now think this the right approach to only check the collection field name and not the subfield names because their full names are different anyway: `otherModel.pt` when `otherModel` is added to the NTuple.
Yes, I agree with ought to only check the top level field name.
